title: Windows: create-sibling is dysfunctional
body:
When taking a closer look at the test failure of ``datalad.distribution.tests.test_publish.test_since_empty_and_unsupported`` in #5210 I noticed that there are ``mkdir -p`` calls in the code base of "create sibling". Windows, unfortunately, has [its own mkdir command](https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/mkdir) that does not take any flags. Consequently, when calling ``create sibling`` in a dataset, the command fails and leaves behind an empty ``-p/`` directory:

```
(base) C:\Users\mih\adinatests>datalad create blabla
[INFO] Creating a new annex repo at C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla
[INFO] Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
[INFO] Disabling ssh connection caching.
[INFO] Detected a crippled filesystem.
[INFO] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time)
[INFO] Entering an adjusted branch where files are unlocked as this filesystem does not support locked files.
[INFO] Switched to branch 'adjusted/master(unlocked)'
create(ok): C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla (dataset)

(base) C:\Users\mih\adinatests>cd blabla

(base) C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla>datalad create-sibling ../onebla
[INFO] Considering to create a target dataset C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla at C:\Users\mih\adinatests\onebla of localhost
[INFO] Fetching updates for Dataset("C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla")
[INFO] Adjusting remote git configuration
[INFO] Running post-update hooks in all created siblings
create_sibling(error): C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla (dataset) [failed to run post-update hook under remote path C:\Users\mih\adinatests\onebla (CommandError: 'cd "C:\Users\mih\adinatests\onebla\.git" && ( [ -x hooks/post-update ] && hooks/post-update || : )' failed with exitcode 1 [err: 'Der Befehl ":" ist entweder falsch geschrieben oder
konnte nicht gefunden werden.'] [cmd.py:run:514])]

(base) C:\Users\mih\adinatests\blabla>ls
-p
```
